page.title: 05TOURIST AND CHURCHES
page.content: Many people will pass by thinking that St James's Chapel in Fore Street is the parish church. In truth the latter is on the hill to the west of the town, last link with Okehamptons original Saxon site of Ocmundtune. The parish church has recently been subject to interior renovation by parishioners. The result shows off well the beautiful roof timbers, granite colonnade and stained glass thus enhancing this active place of worship. The church in Fore St. is also well care for, recently being re-roofed. I suspect tourist have to find the best parts of Okehampton; Simmons Park appears first rather small but opens out to pleasing river side walks. The castle is a little way from the town. It could be a rewarding place to stop in rather than be stopped in! See By-pass page.
